revised_title: Researches on Radiant Heat: Contributions to Molecular Physics
topics: Absorption and Emission of Radiant Heat
tldr: The author investigates the absorption and emission of radiant heat by various liquids and their vapors, concluding that the state of aggregation has a subordinate role in their behavior. The study also reveals the importance of the chemical constitution and the complexity of molecules in absorption and radiation processes. Furthermore, the author discusses the optical properties of substances and their relation to the periods of oscillation of ethereal waves.
